docfields.name: deprecated
docfields.text: Deprecated List Member KTextEdit clickMessage const since 5.0 use QTextEdit::placeholderText instead Member KTextEdit setClickMessage const QString msg since 5.0 use QTextEdit::setPlaceholderText instead

docfields.name: KFind
docfields.keyword: KFind
docfields.text: S.R.Haque David Faure Arend van Beelen jr Detail This class includes prompt handling etc Also provides some static functions which can be used to create custom behavior instead of using the class directly Example To use the class to implement a complete find feature In the slot connected to the find action after using KFindDialog If you are using a non-modal find dialog recommended you should call right away m_find- closeFindNextDialog() Then initialize the variables determining the to the cursor if the option FromCursor is set to the beginning of the selection if the option SelectedText is set and to the beginning of the document otherwise Initialize the variables as well end of doc or end of selection Swap begin and end if FindBackwards Finally call slotFindNext() Don t forget to delete m_find in the destructor of your class unless you gave it a parent widget on construction This implementation allows to have a action which resumes the search even if the user closed the dialog A action can simply switch temporarily the value of FindBackwards and call slotFindNext() and reset the value afterwards

docfields.name: KRichTextEdit
docfields.keyword: KRichTextEdit
docfields.text: It offers several additional rich text editing functions to KTextEdit and makes them easier to access including Changing fonts sizes Font formatting such as bold underline italic foreground and background color Paragraph alignment Ability to edit and remove hyperlinks Nested list handling Simple actions to insert tables TODO The KRichTextEdit can be in two modes Rich text mode and plain text mode Calling functions which modify the format/style of the text will automatically enable the rich text mode Rich text mode is sometimes also referred to as HTML mode Do not call setAcceptRichText() or acceptRichText() yourself Instead simply connect to the slots which insert the rich text use switchToPlainText() or enableRichTextMode() KDE Rich Text Edit Widget 4.1

docfields.name: KTextEdit::createHighlighter

docfields.text: Normally the highlighter returned by createHighlighter() will be used to detect and highlight incorrectly spelled words but this function allows to set a custom highlighter This has to be called after enabling spell checking with setCheckSpellingEnabled() otherwise it has no effect Ownership is transferred to the KTextEdit highlighter() createHighlighter() highLighter the new highlighter which will be used now

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget
docfields.keyword: KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: This class implements common actions which are often used with KRichTextEdit All you need to do is to call createActions() and the actions will be added to your KXMLGUIWindow Remember to also add the chosen actions to your application ui.rc file See the KRichTextWidget::RichTextSupportValues enum for an overview of supported actions Stephen Kelly Thomas McGuire KDE Rich Text Widget 4.1

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::RichTextSupportValues
docfields.keyword: RichTextSupportValues KRichTextWidget::RichTextSupportValues KRichTextWidget

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::DisableRichText
docfields.keyword: DisableRichText KRichTextWidget::DisableRichText KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: No rich text support at all no actions will be created Do not use in combination with other flags

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportBold
docfields.keyword: SupportBold KRichTextWidget::SupportBold KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to format the selected text as bold If no text is selected the word under the cursor is formatted bold This is a KToggleAction The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportItalic
docfields.keyword: SupportItalic KRichTextWidget::SupportItalic KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to format the selected text as italic If no text is selected the word under the cursor is formatted italic This is a KToggleAction The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportUnderline
docfields.keyword: SupportUnderline KRichTextWidget::SupportUnderline KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to underline the selected text If no text is selected the word under the cursor is underlined This is a KToggleAction The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportStrikeOut
docfields.keyword: SupportStrikeOut KRichTextWidget::SupportStrikeOut KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to strike out the selected text If no text is selected the word under the cursor is struck out This is a KToggleAction The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportFontFamily
docfields.keyword: SupportFontFamily KRichTextWidget::SupportFontFamily KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to change the font family of the currently selected text If no text is selected the font family of the word under the cursor is changed Displayed as a combobox when inserted into the toolbar This is a KFontAction The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportFontSize
docfields.keyword: SupportFontSize KRichTextWidget::SupportFontSize KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to change the font size of the currently selected text If no text is selected the font size of the word under the cursor is changed Displayed as a combobox when inserted into the toolbar This is a KFontSizeAction The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportTextForegroundColor
docfields.keyword: SupportTextForegroundColor KRichTextWidget::SupportTextForegroundColor KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to change the text color of the currently selected text If no text is selected the text color of the word under the cursor is changed Opens a QColorDialog to select the color

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportTextBackgroundColor
docfields.keyword: SupportTextBackgroundColor KRichTextWidget::SupportTextBackgroundColor KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to change the background color of the currently selected text If no text is selected the backgound color of the word under the cursor is changed Opens a QColorDialog to select the color

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::FullTextFormattingSupport
docfields.keyword: FullTextFormattingSupport KRichTextWidget::FullTextFormattingSupport KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: A combination of all the flags above Includes all actions that change the format of the text

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportChangeListStyle
docfields.keyword: SupportChangeListStyle KRichTextWidget::SupportChangeListStyle KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to make the current line a list element change the list style or remove list formatting Displayed as a combobox when inserted into a toolbar This is a KSelectAction The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportIndentLists
docfields.keyword: SupportIndentLists KRichTextWidget::SupportIndentLists KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to increase the current list nesting level This makes it possible to create nested lists

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportDedentLists
docfields.keyword: SupportDedentLists KRichTextWidget::SupportDedentLists KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to decrease the current list nesting level

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::FullListSupport
docfields.keyword: FullListSupport KRichTextWidget::FullListSupport KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: All of the three list actions above Includes all list-related actions

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportAlignment
docfields.keyword: SupportAlignment KRichTextWidget::SupportAlignment KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Actions to align the current paragraph left righ center or justify These actions are KToogleActions The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportRuleLine
docfields.keyword: SupportRuleLine KRichTextWidget::SupportRuleLine KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to insert a horizontal line

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportHyperlinks
docfields.keyword: SupportHyperlinks KRichTextWidget::SupportHyperlinks KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to convert the current text to a hyperlink If no text is selected the word under the cursor is converted This action opens a dialog where the user can enter the link target

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportFormatPainting
docfields.keyword: SupportFormatPainting KRichTextWidget::SupportFormatPainting KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to make the mouse cursor a format painter The user can select text with that painter The selected text gets the same format as the text that was previously selected

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportToPlainText
docfields.keyword: SupportToPlainText KRichTextWidget::SupportToPlainText KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to change the text of the whole text edit to plain text All rich text formatting will get lost

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportSuperScriptAndSubScript
docfields.keyword: SupportSuperScriptAndSubScript KRichTextWidget::SupportSuperScriptAndSubScript KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Actions to format text as superscript or subscript If no text is selected the word under the cursor is formatted as selected This is a KToggleAction The status is automatically updated when the text cursor is moved

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::SupportDirection
docfields.keyword: SupportDirection KRichTextWidget::SupportDirection KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Action to change direction of text to Right-To-Left or Left-To-Right

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::FullSupport
docfields.keyword: FullSupport KRichTextWidget::FullSupport KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Includes all above actions for full rich text support

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::setActionsEnabled
docfields.keyword: setActionsEnabled KRichTextWidget::setActionsEnabled KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: This may be useful in cases where rich text mode may be set on or off enabled Whether to enable or disable the actions

docfields.keyword: KRichTextWidget KRichTextWidget::KRichTextWidget KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: parent the parent widget

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::KRichTextWidget
docfields.keyword: KRichTextWidget KRichTextWidget::KRichTextWidget KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: text The initial text of the text edit which is interpreted as HTML parent The parent widget

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::~KRichTextWidget
docfields.keyword: KRichTextWidget::~KRichTextWidget KRichTextWidget

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::createActions
docfields.keyword: createActions KRichTextWidget::createActions KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Call this before calling setupGUI() in your application but after calling setRichTextSupport() The XML file of your KXmlGuiWindow needs to have the action names in them so that the actions actually appear in the menu and in the toolbars Below is a list of actions that are created depending on the supported rich text subset set by setRichTextSupport() The list contains action names Those names need to be the same in your XML file See the KRichTextWidget::RichTextSupportValues enum documentation for a detailed explaination of each action XML Name RichTextSupportValues flag format_text_foreground_color SupportTextForegroundColor format_text_background_color SupportTextBackgroundColor format_font_family SupportFontFamily format_font_size SupportFontSize format_text_bold SupportBold format_text_italic SupportItalic format_text_underline SupportUnderline format_text_strikeout SupportStrikeOut format_align_left SupportAlignment format_align_center SupportAlignment format_align_right SupportAlignment format_align_justify SupportAlignment direction_ltr SupportDirection direction_rtl SupportDirection format_list_style SupportChangeListStyle format_list_indent_more SupportIndentLists format_list_indent_less SupportDedentLists insert_horizontal_rule SupportRuleLine manage_link SupportHyperlinks format_painter SupportFormatPainting action_to_plain_text SupportToPlainText format_text_subscript format_text_superscript SupportSuperScriptAndSubScript 5.0

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::richTextSupport
docfields.keyword: richTextSupport KRichTextWidget::richTextSupport KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: The supported subset

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::setRichTextSupport
docfields.keyword: setRichTextSupport KRichTextWidget::setRichTextSupport KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: The default is KRichTextWidget::FullSupport and will be set in the constructor You need to call createActions() afterwards support The supported subset

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::updateActionStates
docfields.keyword: updateActionStates KRichTextWidget::updateActionStates KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: This is normally automatically done but there might be a few cases where you ll need to manually call this function Call this function only after calling createActions()

docfields.name: KRichTextWidget::mouseReleaseEvent
docfields.keyword: mouseReleaseEvent KRichTextWidget::mouseReleaseEvent KRichTextWidget
docfields.text: Catches mouse release events Used to know when a selection has been completed

docfields.name: KTextEdit
docfields.keyword: KTextEdit
docfields.text: This is just a little subclass of QTextEdit implementing some standard KDE features like cursor auto-hiding configurable wheelscrolling fast-scroll or zoom spell checking and deleting of entire words with Ctrl-Backspace or Ctrl-Delete This text edit provides two ways of spell checking background checking which will mark incorrectly spelled words red and a spell check dialog which lets the user check and correct all incorrectly spelled words Basic rule whenever you want to use QTextEdit use KTextEdit! KDE Text Edit Widget QTextEdit Carsten Pfeiffer

docfields.name: index
docfields.text: KTextWidgets Text editing widgets Introduction KTextWidgets provides widgets for displaying and editing text It supports rich text as well as plain text
